alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:57AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Louisa, southwestern Jackson, Cedar, Johnson, northeastern Washington, southern Jones, northwestern Muscatine, southeastern Linn and northwestern Clinton Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 157 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Heights, or near Iowa City, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... University Heights around 200 AM CDT. Iowa City, Coralville, Tiffin and Oakdale around 205 AM CDT. North Liberty and Lake Macbride State Park around 210 AM CDT. Solon around 215 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ely, Mount Vernon, Lisbon, Bertram, Mechanicsville, Springville, Martelle and Morley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 238 and 264. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington
